page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF SUTTON
page.content: Sutton is a small,isolated Bedfordshire village which extends from Sutton Crossroads on the B1040 Biggleswade-Potton road.The one road,High Street,passes through the village to be crossed partway by a tributary of the River Ivel at the Ford.High Street is flanked at intervals by various types of buildings from period timber-framed houses to modern executive type homes.The main features of the village are All Saints'Church dating from the late 12th century,the Ford and Packhorse Bridge dating from the late 14th century,the Victorian village school built in 1870 and the John O'Gaunt public house.There are 4 farms in the village itself with several others on the outskirts.There are about 100 houses in the village.
